original: Ordeal in $PROVINCENAME$

During our mission to find viable provinces to colonize, we stumbled upon $PROVINCENAME$. Its natives are mostly hostile, but the land is very prosperous. We would gain much from trading with this province. Although we might need to bribe a chief or two...
translation: 在执行任务寻找可殖民的土地时，我们在$PROVINCENAME$遇到了阻碍。其原住民大都对我们抱有敌意，但这块土地是非常富裕的。我们可以与其贸易以大额获利。尽管我们可能需要贿赂一两个酋长……

original: Make them a fair deal.
Make them a dishonest deal.
$PROVINCENAME$ Troopers

Our expedition encountered hostile natives from $PROVINCENAME$ which led them to flee from the province. A few of the crew had disembarked to find fresh water and were returning to the ship when five native canoes with armed men appeared. The crew turned their boat around and raced back to the boat with the canoes just behind. One of the canoes nearly caught up with the boat, but as the men prepared for a fight the canoe slowed down as to wait for the others. The ship escaped, but some of the crew were wounded. A poisoned arrow hit one of the men in the leg, and although the wound was disinfected with urine and olive oil, we do not know if the man will survive.
translation: 我们的考察队遇到了来自$PROVINCENAME$的怀有敌意的原住民,这导致了他们不得不逃离这片土地。一些船员登陆以寻找淡水，在他们归船时五条承载着土著武士的独木舟出现了。 船员们立刻调转小艇并拼命划向舰船，原住民驶着独木舟紧随其后。一条独木舟几乎要追上小艇，幸好船员们做好了战斗的准备，那条独木舟不得不减速来等待伙伴跟上。舰船成功逃亡了，但是有些船员受伤了。一个船员的膝盖中了一支毒箭，尽管用小便和橄榄油消毒了伤口，这个船员依然是生死未卜。

original: See if some tawdry trinkets will placate the natives.
translation: 看看一些便宜的小饰品能否安抚这些原住民.

original: Get back there, kill the natives and take their gold!
translation: 再次前往,戮其命,夺其金!

original: Stranger in a Strange Land

As our ship approaches $PROVINCENAME$ large numbers of gift laden canoes start to follow it. The canoes' occupants have fearlessly boarded the vessel and two seemingly important fellows are trying to persuade the ship's captain to follow them to [Root.Capital.GetCapitalName]. Their intentions seem innocent and we can espy from the few words our translator can pick out that we have arrived just in time for a festival of some sort. Our ship's mast formation, sails and rigging resemble certain significant artefacts for the natives and our clockwise route around the island mirrored the path the processions take during this festival. This has convinced the natives that we are friendly but one false move and it might change...
translation: 正当我们的舰船靠近$PROVINCENAME$时，大量载着礼物的独木舟开始跟随。独木舟的船员们毫不畏惧地登上甲板，其中两个看似重要的船员尝试劝说船长跟随他们前往[Root.Capital.GetCapitalName]。他们的动机似乎是善意的，我们能从翻译能听懂的一些词语中发现我们刚好在一个某种节日的时候到来。这些土著看来我们舰船的桅杆结构，船帆和索具像是某个有象征意义的文物，并且我们顺时针绕岛而行的航线恰好与节庆中游行船队的航线相同。这使土著们相信我们是友善的，但是一个错误的举动就可能改变这一切……

original: Accept their primitive traditions.
Stay clear of them and do not make landfall!
translation: 和他们划清界线，绝不登陆！

original: Glory Road

The lookout had reported signs of dwellings but the ship had yet to see any natives until at long last a coastal village in $PROVINCENAME$ were sighted. A small force disembarked and was hospitably received, something that was attributed to the natives' fascination with the men who were taller in stature than them and bearded. The natives were beardless and with some difficulty they managed to communicate that their myths and legends foretold of a time when their bearded gods would come from the sea to visit them. Food and gold were given, which indicates that the province is prosperous and would be of great value to us.
translation: 瞭望员曾报告发现人类住所的迹象但船员并未发现任何原住民，直到发现$PROVINCENAME$的一个沿海村庄。小股船员登岸拜访并遭到热情款待，似乎是由于原住民对于比他们高大健壮或是有胡须的人十分迷恋。原住民却是没有胡须的，克服了一些困难后他们设法表达他们的神话传说预示了有一天他们长着胡须的神会从海上来见他们。招待船员用的食物和黄金表明了这片土地的富裕，这对我们有着巨大的价值。

original: This is a promising land!
The Ship into Summer

The words of Christopher Columbus describe the tribe we found in $PROVINCENAME$ perfectly: 'They traded with us and gave us everything they had, with good will... they took great delight in pleasing us.. They are very gentle and without knowledge of what is evil, nor do they murder or steal... Your highness may believe that in all the world there can be no better people... They love their neighbors as themselves, and they have the sweetest talk in the world, and are gentle and always laughing.'
translation: 在$PROVINCENAME$发现的部落可以用克里斯托弗·哥伦布的话完美地描述: “其与我交易而出诸,携美志...彼甚欣然悦我..举措甚雅, 不知何事恶, 其亦不作杀盗等事...陛下可信世间无比焉之类也...其如爱身般爱邻,且有天下最可心醉之谈吐, 常事以绅道, 常欢笑。”

original: Take advantage of them!
Make good use of their gentle ways.
translation: 好好利用他们的绅士之道.

original: Unwelcome Passenger

The village had been abandoned for some time, the failing crops spoke of a drought that must have plagued the province for quite some time. As we returned to our ship, we got a dreadful shock: one of the largest bears we've ever seen trying to climb aboard the ship! The seamen decided to capture the starved beast with the hope of bringing it back to our country, but the bear had other plans. It was leashed and brought aboard the ship, but the bear fought itself free of the ropes and we had to kill it. This attack and the devastated state $PROVINCENAME$ is in has made us realize that it is a lost cause.
translation: 这个村落被荒弃已有一段时间, 这片土地上枯萎的作物无声地诉说着长年累月的干旱。正当我们归船之时,我们差点被吓死:我们一生中见过的最大的熊正在尝试爬上船!海员们决定抓住这头饥饿的野兽,并把它带回国。但那头熊并不同意，它被绑住并带上船,但他挣脱了绳子，因而我们不得不杀了它。这一攻击和$PROVINCENAME$的破败使我们认识到在此殖民注定失败。

original: A real shame.
The Green Hills of $PROVINCENAME$

The natives in $PROVINCENAME$ were enthralled by the glass beads, brass bells, and cloth our explorers traded for fresh fish and venison. In their report to us the ship's crew spoke about that there was very little wealth among the people and they seemed peaceful. Some events troubled them, as the villagers for some reason deserted their homes one night and left the village to be explored by the members of the expedition. Nothing much was found, only a small rattle made of gold buried among some fishing nets bore witness that this province might yield some fortune for us.
translation: $PROVINCENAME$的原住民对我们的探险家用以交换鲜鱼和鹿肉的玻璃珠、铜铃、布匹十分痴迷。在他们的报告中船员谈到这些人民中只有很少的财富，而且他们看起来很爱好和平。有些事却困扰了他们，出于一些原因村民们一夜间废弃了他们的家园并离开了村落，只留下空空的村落让探险队的成员探索。他们没有发现很多东西，只有一个小金环被埋藏在渔网堆中，可见一斑的是这片土地或许能为我们产出点财宝。

original: How great!
Beyond This Horizon

As our exploration ship idled off the coast of $PROVINCENAME$, a couple of curious natives in canoes paddled out to the ship. The crew invited the natives aboard after gestures were exchanged that expressed peaceful intentions. Food and drink were shared with the natives before they set back into their canoes and returned to $PROVINCENAME$. Encouraged by the report of the initial pacific encounter, six more canoes decided to paddle out to the caravel.
translation: 我们的探险船停泊在$PROVINCENAME$的海岸之时，一队好奇的原住民驶着独木舟划了过来。在相互以手势示意友善意图后船员邀请了原住民登舰。在他们回到独木舟上驶回$PROVINCENAME$之前，我们与之分享了食物和饮料。受这初次的太平洋偶遇的报告所鼓动，又有六条独木舟决定驶向我们的卡拉维尔帆船。

original: Invite them again.
Capture them!
The Menace from $PROVINCENAME$

After a rather turbulent beginning with the natives of $PROVINCENAME$ we finally managed to convince them of our good intentions. As we made landfall two men, one old and one young, approached our ship. They were not interested in our gifts and when a musket was fired over their heads to make them back away, it wounded the older man slightly. He ran to their huts and brought men who threw spears at our crew until they were chased off after two more rounds were fired. The adults fled into the woods, leaving their children behind. Some small trinkets and beads were left behind with the children as a gesture of friendship before the expedition members retreated to the ship.
translation: 在与$PROVINCENAME$的原住民的来往有了一个十分激烈的开端之后，我们最终成功地使之相信了我们的善意。在我们登岸后，一老一少两人靠近了我们的舰船。他们并不对我们的礼物感兴趣，而当有人向他们头顶开枪示意退避时，老人受到了轻伤，奔向他们的棚屋并带人来向我们掷矛，直到两轮齐射后才被赶走。成年人遁入林中，只留下了他们的儿童以及一些小饰品和珠粒，以示友善，直到让探险队员撤回船上。

original: Make them understand we meant them no harm.
translation: 让他们明白我们没有恶意.

original: If they return - kill them!
translation: 如果他们敢回来-就杀光他们!

original: The $PROVINCENAME$ Beasts

Before we went on the expedition, we had heard tales of an explorer by the name of Hanno who had found an island populated with a 'hirsute and savage people'. Hanno had made attempts to capture the males which failed, but three females were taken. Their ferocious nature forced the explorer to kill them and to bring proof of this savages, their skins were preserved for transport. These people were called 'gorillae' by the interpreters traveling with Hanno. We assume that the apelike specie we found in $PROVINCENAME$ must be these Gorillae Hanno spoke of.
translation: 在我们继续探险前，我们听到了一个名为汉诺的探险家发现了一个住满了「多毛的野蛮人」的岛屿的故事。汉诺曾尝试捉住男性蛮族，虽然没有成功，但是捉到了三个女性。她们残暴的天性迫使探险家杀掉她们，她们的皮被保留以运回作为这群蛮族存在的证据。这些人被与汉诺同行的翻译者称为「猩人」。我们认为我们在$PROVINCENAME$发现的这群猿人一定是汉诺谈及的「猩人」。

original: They can be tamed with some baubles.
translation: 用一些玩具可以驯服它们.

original: Grab what you can and get out!
translation: 拿上你的全部家当滚蛋！

original: A Scattering of Poison

The expedition was closing in on $PROVINCENAME$ when a barrage of arrows, shot from the natives standing on the inviting beach, assailed the ship. In the hurry to race away from the enemy, who leapt with great whoops towards their canoes, the crew had to abandon some of the men who had been shot and tumbled overboard. When they had laid some sea miles between $PROVINCENAME$ and themselves, they discovered that the whole starboard side of the ship was covered in arrows.\nThe explorer on board the assailed ship was seriously wounded, the arrow that hit him had been poisoned. He lay in fever, sweating and swearing, for several days. Despite the surgeon's care and the disinfectant made of urine and olive oil, he died some time ago.
translation: 探险队靠近$PROVINCENAME$的时候遇到了箭雨袭击,由站在迷人的海滩上的原住民们射来,袭向舰船.为了赶紧逃离那些蹦跳着大吼着奔向独木舟的原住民,船员们不得不抛弃那些被射中从甲板掉下船的人.当他们与$PROVINCENAME$拉开数海里时,他们发现整个右舷一侧覆盖满了弓箭.\n船上的探险家受到了重伤,他中的箭是带毒的. 他因高烧卧床不起,全身出汗,并向上帝发誓祈祷,持续数日而不止.尽管有医师的精心照料以及用过尿液和橄榄油消毒,他在数日前便死亡了.

original: Such a horrible fate!
Drunken Explorer

One of our expedition members - our explorer, of all people! - managed to get himself into a dreadfully embarrassing situation when he overestimated his own capability of handling the fruity liquor the natives of $PROVINCENAME$ brew. Disgusting details won't make it into this report, but he was sick as a pig for a long time. The natives thought it fun, laughing at his misery, but the rumors of this event has reached the ears of the high socialites who frown upon such behavior.
translation: 我们的探险家成功地使他自己陷入一个可怕的尴尬境地,因为他高估了自己对$PROVINCENAME$的原住民酿造的水果酒的酒量.令人作呕的细节不会在这个报告里出现,但是他像猪一样病了很长时间.原住民们觉得这事很搞笑,都嘲笑他痛苦的样子,但关于此事的传言已经传入会对之皱眉的社会名流耳中.

original: Fruity liquor? Did you bring some back?
Feathery Meals

The only residents of $PROVINCENAME$ seem to be birds, birds, and more birds. The large birds, nicknamed 'penguins' by the ship's crew due to their small wings, seem to be fearless of us. The first one we caught stared at us and could not be bothered to fly or run away. When we grabbed it by its leg and held it upside-down, it made a great noise. The flock of penguins around us came running to its assistance and tried to bite us with their large beaks. Our provisions are low and these birds are fat and look good enough to eat.
translation: 似乎$PROVINCENAME$的唯一居民只有鸟雀,雀鸟,以及更多的鸟。被船员们因其小翅膀而昵称为'企鹅'的一种大型的鸟类似乎并不惧怕我们。我们捉到的第一只企鹅一直盯着我们看,而且似乎不打算飞走或逃跑。但当我们抓住它的腿然后把它的头朝下的时候,它发出了巨大的叫声。我们身旁的企鹅群都跑来救助它, 并尝试用它们大大的喙啄咬我们。我们的存粮已经不多，而这群肥鸟看起来应该挺好吃的。

original: Leave the birds alone.
If it moves - eat it!
translation: 如果它逼近 - 就干掉它！

original: Unexpected Explorer

As the ship entered the bay of $PROVINCENAME$, a small crowd of natives had gathered on the beach and were silently regarding the expedition. The ship's mate jumped into a spontaneous and cheerful dance to the accompaniment of pipes. The natives started laughing which broke the tension. Food and drink was brought down to the beach for them all to feast upon. One of the natives showed great interest in the ship, the swords, and other pieces of equipment brought by one of the expedition members. With the help of the translator, the young woman spoke of her knowledge of the nearby islands and of her great desire to see more of the world.
translation: 当舰船进入$PROVINCENAME$的海湾时，一小群原住民聚集在海滩上静静地观察着探险队。船上的大副随着笛声伴奏开始自发地跳起欢快的舞蹈。原住民们开始大笑，同时消除了焦虑。食物和饮料被带到海滩以款待他们。其中一人对舰船，刀剑，和一个探险队员携带的其他器具有着浓厚的兴趣。多亏了翻译者的协助，这个年轻的女人说出了她对周遭岛屿的了解以及她对了解更大世界的渴望。

original: Bring her with you and make an explorer out of her.
translation: 把她带在你身边并培养成为一个探险者.

original: It is better for her to stay where she is.
translation: 对她而言待在老地方更适合。

original: Dead on Arrival

The life on board a ship is a lonesome one. In a few provinces the expeditions visited there were no shortage of willing arms to embrace and staunch the loneliness for a little while. Overly close contact with the natives may have caused the explorer's death, as he caught a strange disease which rapidly deteriorated his condition and led to heart failure. He was given a burial at sea, not far from $PROVINCENAME$.
translation: 航海的生涯是孤独的。在一些探险队去过的地方，不缺少愿意拥抱他们的双臂以排遣须臾的孤独，这令他们选择停留了一段时间。与原住民太过亲密的接触导致了探险家的离世，因为他染上了一种迅速恶化的怪病并导致了心脏衰竭。他在离$PROVINCENAME$不远处被赋予了海葬。

original: Rest in peace.
The First Circumnavigation

Our fleet set sail to find a western sea route to the rich Spice Islands of Indonesia. It took them 99 days to cross the ocean westward, after they had found the Strait of Magellan located near the tip of South America. The strait was treacherous and when they finally reached the ocean, the captain wept with joy. The ocean was so strangely calm it was named 'Pacific', from the Latin word for 'Tranquil'.\n\nThe fleet's captain died from a wound caused by a poisoned arrow when assisting the chief of Cebú in conquering a rival tribe. Two of our ships had survived, one tried to return across the Pacific but perished. The last ship continued west and sailed across the Indian Ocean, rounded the Cape of Good Hope, and as it arrived at our port it became the first ship to circumnavigate the globe.
translation: 我们的舰队启航寻找通往富饶印尼香料群岛的西方航路。他们发现南美底端的麦哲伦海峡之后，耗时99日继续西行。这条海峡喜怒无常，当他们终于通过它到达宽广洋面之时，船长喜极而泣。这片海洋如此平静，因此被命名为「太平洋」，取自拉丁语「宁静」之意。\n\n舰队的船长在协助宿雾酋长征服敌对部落时身中毒箭而死。两艘船存活了下来，其中一艘试图回到太平洋但遭遇了船难。最后一艘则继续西行，船员跨越了印度洋，绕过好望角，最终到达我们的港口，成为第一艘完成环球航行的船只。

original: We are the first to circumnavigate the globe!
translation: 我们是首个成功环球航行的！

original: The Second Circumnavigation
We are not the first to have managed to circumnavigate the globe, but nevertheless it is a great feat and it will be celebrated throughout the land!
translation: 我们并非第一个成功环球航行的，但至少这是一个伟大的功绩并会在全国各地被庆祝！

original: A fabulous feat, even if we were not the first...
translation: 极好的功绩，尽管不是第一个...

original: Our fleet set sail to find a sea route to the rich cities of Europe. It took them 99 days to cross the ocean westward, after they had found the Cape of Good Hope located near the tip of Africa.\n\nThe fleet's captain died from a wound caused by a poisoned arrow when assisting a local chief in conquering a rival tribe but two of our ships had survived, one tried to return across the seas but perished. The last ship continued west and sailed across the Pacific Ocean, and as it arrived at our port it became the first ship to circumnavigate the globe.
translation: 我们的舰队启航去寻找一条通往富饶的欧洲城市的航线。99天之后，舰队向西穿越了大洋并抵达了非洲大陆的尽头，他们将发现的这个海角命名为好望角。\n\n舰队的指挥官在参与协助一个当地酋长对敌对部落的征服时，不幸被毒箭射中而箭疮毒发身亡。所幸的是在战后我们还有两艘探险船幸存了下来，其中一艘想要沿着来路返回家乡却不幸沉没。最后一艘探险船继续西行穿越了太平洋，并最终抵达了我们的港口，成为了有史以来第一艘完成环球航行的壮举的船只。

original: Our fleet set sail to find a western sea route to the rich Spice Islands of Indonesia. It took them 99 days to cross the ocean westward, after they had found the Strait of Magellan located near the tip of South America. The strait was treacherous and when they finally reached the ocean, the captain wept with joy.\n\nThe fleet's captain died from a wound caused by a poisoned arrow when assisting the chief of Cebú in conquering a rival tribe. Two of our ships had survived, one tried to return across the Pacific but perished. The last ship continued west and sailed across the Indian Ocean and as it arrived at our port it became the first ship to circumnavigate the globe.
translation: 我们的舰队向西方海域启航，去寻找一条通往富饶的印度尼西亚香料群岛的航线。99天之后，舰队向西穿越了大洋并抵达了美洲大陆的最南端，他们将此地命名为麦哲伦海峡，指挥官喜极而泣。\n\n舰队的指挥官在参与协助宿务酋长对敌对部落的征服时，不幸被毒箭射中而箭疮毒发身亡。所幸的是在战后我们还有两艘探险船幸存了下来，其中一艘想要由太平洋返回家乡却不幸沉没。最后一艘探险船继续西行穿越了印度洋，并最终抵达了我们的港口，成为了有史以来第一艘完成环球航行的壮举的船只。

original: Our fleet set sail to find a western sea route to the fabled rich Islands and Cities of the west. It took them many days to cross the ocean westward, after they had found the Indonesian Islands.\n\nThe fleet's captain died from a wound caused by a poisoned arrow when assisting a local chief in conquering a rival tribe. Two of our ships had survived, one tried to return across the open sea but perished. The last ship continued west and sailed across the Indian Ocean, rounded the Cape of Good Hope, and as it arrived at our port it became the first ship to circumnavigate the globe.
translation: 我们的舰队向西方海域启航，去寻找西方著名的富饶岛屿与城邦。许多天之后，舰队向西穿越了大洋，发现了印度尼西亚群岛。\n\n舰队的指挥官在参与协助一个当地酋长对敌对部落的征服时，不幸被毒箭射中而箭疮毒发身亡。所幸的是在战后我们还有两艘探险船幸存了下来，其中一艘想要沿着外海返回家乡却不幸沉没。最后一艘探险船继续西行穿越了印度洋，绕过了好望角，并最终抵达了我们的港口，成为了有史以来第一艘完成环球航行的壮举的船只。

original: After a long voyage, our Imperial Fleet has discovered a sea route from the Middle Kingdom and back again, a route circumnavigating the entire globe! It took our explorers 49 days to reach the land of Five Inds, and another 49 days to Tianfang - known locally as Mecca. From there, they sailed for another 7 weeks into the Great Western Ocean the barbarians call the Atlantic until reaching the Americas. A continent we are told is named after a certain savage chief. After 99 days our fleet managed to find a route around this continent into another ocean. An ocean so calm, they decided to name it Taiping - the tranquil one, to celebrate the peaceful world under the Son of Heaven's rule!\n\nThe Fleet's captain and many other sailors died of exotic illness during the voyage over the Taiping Ocean, but most of our ships survived to eventually find themselves approaching the Land of Rising Sun. After a short last leg our glorious Fleet became the first one to circumnavigate the globe as it arrived back in its own home port.
translation: 经过漫长的航行后，帝国水师发现了从中土出发并返回的海上航线，一条环游全球的航线！我们的探险家花了49天到达五印之地，又花了49天到达当地称为麦加的天方。从那里，他们又航行了49天穿过大西洋海域——蛮夷称之为亚特兰蒂斯——到达亚美利加大陆，据说这片大陆是以某个蛮夷酋长的名字命名的。99天后，帝国水师设法绕过了这片大陆驶入另一片海洋。这是一片如此平静的海洋，他们决定把它命名为太平洋——取天下太平之义，以称颂天子治下的太平盛世！\n\n水师提督和许多水手在太平洋上航行时亡于异国疫病，但大多数船员幸存了下来，并发现水师已经接近日升之地。经过短暂的最后一程，我们光荣的水师完成了有史以来第一次环球航行的壮举，回到了自己的家乡。

original:
Shah [Root.Monarch.GetName] bin $RANDOM_OLD_MONARCH$ Khan el-Muzaffar Daima

To my venerable vizier, orderer of the world, director of the affairs of the community and guardian of my Well-Protected Domains: upon receipt of this order let it be generally known that our expedition of discovery has returned a success. Our most favored navigators departed from Kostantiniyye in the month of Muharrem, intent on expanding our knowledge about the world. Upon reaching the New Clime they demonstrated this continent's limits by bypassing it to the south, and arrived in the great ocean separating it from the land of Hitay. This they named el-Bahrü's-selam in honor of its peaceful nature. From there they visited the lands of Java and Hind, and informed the local Believers of the power of my Sublime State – it is said that my felicitous name is even mentioned in their Friday prayers. Under the protection of Allah the Exalted, they returned to us by way of Egypt. Let this event serve as a clear demonstration of the might and reach of the House of Osman across all the Seven Climes, and let the ambassadors of foreign nations hear also of our lofty achievements.

Recorded in the first trimester of the noble month of Ramadan, in Kostantiniyye, the Well-Protected.
translation:
沙阿[Root.Monarch.GetName] $RANDOM_OLD_MONARCH$穆扎法尔汗

至德高望重的大臣，发号施令者，国家政事的管理者和疆域的守护者：收到这个命令后，让所有人知道我们的探险队发回了成功的消息。我们最青睐的航海家在圣月驶离君士坦丁堡，为扩大我们对世界的认知而启航。在新风带，船队的航道勾勒着新大陆的边界，又从南方绕过它，到达将它和契丹的土地分开的大洋。他们把那里命名为“平安洋”，以向平静的自然表达敬意。他们参观了爪哇和信德的土地，在那里我国的辉煌成就吸引了众多信徒–据说他们的主麻日祈祷中甚至提到了我的名字。在真主的保护下，他们竟然通过埃及回到这里。让这个事件作为国家权威的清晰展示和奥斯曼到达七大洲的佐证，并让外国大使也知晓我们崇高的成就。

记录于神圣斋月的第一周，于君士坦丁堡，望妥善保管。

original: Up until now we have believed that the world is made up of three big regions: Japan, China and India. Recently we have also learned of the 'Nanban' civilization of Southern Barbarians and in order to contact them directly beyond the high seas, we organized a grand expedition. Our fleet explored tropical islands in the south and met people with exotic customs in the west. Our ships sailed between drift ices in the north and discovered unknown continents and islands in the east.\nAs the greatest result of this expedition, our sailors have been the first in the world to circumnavigate the globe! The Emperor was very pleased with our achievement when our ships finally returned to home. His Highness invited the commander in chief and other crew members of the fleet to the Imperial Court and held a glorious audience the like of which hasn't been recorded before. This event will be remembered as the memorial day for when Japan rose to dominate the seven seas.
translation: 时至今日，我们都还以为世界仅由三大地区组成：日本、中国和印度。最近我们还了解到南蛮之地的“南蛮”文明。为了跨过大洋直接联络到他们，我们开始了盛大的远征。我们的船队在南部探索热带岛屿，在西方遇见了一些具有异国风情的人；我们的船在北方海域的流冰间航行，在东方发现了未知的大陆和岛屿。\n这次远征有了伟大的收获，我们完成了世界上第一次环球航行！当我们的船返回家园时，天皇对我们的成就感到非常满意。陛下邀请舰队司令和其他舰队军官去朝廷觐见，并第一次以听众的身份听取了航行见闻。这一事件将作为日本于崛起七大洋的开端，永世铭记。

original: Worship
Disturbed Ritual
Angry Natives
Friendly Natives
Drunken Explorer
An explorer, drunk on fruity liquor, has embarrassed the whole nation and himself.
translation: 一个喝水果酒而醉倒的探险家使得整个国家和他自己蒙羞。

original: El Dorado

An adventurer on his death bed told a tale about a gold covered king who washed the gold off while his attendants threw trinkets of gold and precious stones into the lake. The man claimed to have been rescued by El Hombre Dorado himself and seen the ritual and the golden city with his own eyes. Before he fell ill, he made a crude map that he claims shows the way to El Dorado. Now when we have arrived in $PROVINCENAME$, a landmark corresponds to one of the few roughly drawn on the adventurer's map.
translation: 一个冒险家在垂死病榻时讲述了一个全身涂满金粉的皇帝将金粉洗掉了，而他的仆人们把金饰和宝石投入湖中的故事。他声称被黄金人本人所救并亲眼目睹了仪式和黄金之城。在他病倒之前，他画下一幅粗略的地图，他声称这张地图指明了通往黄金国的道路。现在我们已经到达$PROVINCENAME$，在冒险家的地图上数个粗略画下的地标之一。

original: Follow that map! It will lead to great treasures.
translation: 跟着地图走！它将引向大秘宝。

original: Try to find something of real value.
translation: 试着去找点真的有价值的东西吧。

original: Fountain of Youth

Tales of a fountain that brings eternal youth to anyone who bathes in its waters or drinks from it have long been known. Some have always rejected this idea, while others have searched for it to no avail. We will be successful in finding the Water of Life, this Fountain of Youth, simply because we found someone in $PROVINCENAME$ who has seen it and is willing to take us there - for a price, of course.
translation: 关于一座能为在其中沐浴或是饮用之的人带来永恒青春的喷泉的传说流传已久。时常有人否定其存在，也有人徒劳地寻找它。我们将会成功地发现在青春之泉中喷涌的生命之水，因为我们在$PROVINCENAME$发现有人曾见到过它并且那人愿意为我们带路——当然是有代价的。

original: Pay the man or woman! Anything they want!
translation: 给那个人报酬！任何他们想要的！

original: Too implausible.
Cibola

A scout sent ahead returned with news about Cibola, one of the Seven Cities of Gold. He had met a monk who had heard stories from the natives of $PROVINCENAME$ about a city overflowing with riches. Its people decorated their houses with turquoise, used dishes of gold and silver, and had gigantic pearls, emeralds, and other beautiful gems.
translation: 一个我们派出去的斥候带回了关于黄金七城之一的锡沃拉的新闻。他遇见了一个僧侣，那个僧侣从$PROVINCENAME$的原住民那里听说了关于一座满溢着财富的城市的故事。那座城市里的人用绿宝石来装饰他们的房子，用着金银制作的盘子，还有着巨大的珍珠、祖母绿和其他美丽的宝石。

original: Find the monk and persuade him to lead us to Cibola!
translation: 找到那个僧侣然后说服他带我们去锡沃拉！

original: Why should we trust such a mad man?
translation: 我们为何要相信这样的疯子？

original: City of the Caesars

A city filled with gold, silver and diamonds... What more could one wish for? Our conquistador has found a landmark indicating that this is the path to the City of the Caesars, which should be located between two mountains, one of diamonds and the other of gold. We need experienced guides, interpreters to talk with the natives, and supplies of many different kinds in order to continue this expedition. The reward will be great, if we find the city.
translation: 一座满载黄金,白银和钻石的城市...一个人还能期待更多其他的么？我们的征服者发现了一个地标表明这是通向凯撒之城的道路,它坐落于两山之间,一座漫山钻石,另一座漫山黄金.我们需要有经验的向导,能与原住民交谈的翻译,以及各种支持探险进行的用品供给.如果我们发现了那座城市,将会有巨大的奖赏.

original: Tell me what you need and you'll get it!
Keep exploring and forget about the City of the Caesars.
translation: 继续探索，忘掉凯撒之城吧。

original: Sierra de la Plata

The White King rules the region where the Silver Mountains can be found, or so the crew rescued from a shipwreck claims. While being shipwrecked in $PROVINCENAME$, they became friendly with the natives who told them about a great mountain of shining metals, too far into the mainland to reach for many days, if not weeks. The metals they brought give a corn of truth to this legend, and they have offered to join us in a search for the Sierra de la Plata - the Silver Mountains.
translation: 白银之王统治着一个能找到白银山脉的地区,据在海难中所营救的船员所称大概如此.在$PROVINCENAME$遇到船难后,他们与原住民建立起友谊,并被告知关于一座布满闪光的金属的大山,距离海岸很远,需要数日甚至数周才能到达.他们带着的金属为这个传说带来了一点可靠性,而且他们愿意加入我们去寻找拉普拉塔山-白银之山.

original: Bring them and find the silver!
translation: 带上他们然后找到白银!

original: There's not a corn of truth in that!
Norumbega

A French navigator reported that he had found a great river, more than 40 leagues wide and full of islands. According to his notes, fifteen leagues within this river there is a town called Norumbega, with clever inhabitants who trade in furs of all sorts. They are dressed in furs and wearing sable, with a language similar to Latin. These tall and handsome people worship the sun. The town is very rich and there must be a source for the gold most of the people were wearing as jewellery.
translation: 一个法国航海家报告他发现了一条宽于40里格的大河，河面上点缀着武进岛无尽。根据他的记录，距离这条河15里格内的地方有一座叫做诺诺伦贝加的城市，那里聪明的住民做着交易各种毛皮的贸易。他们身穿皮草披带貂皮，说着一种与拉丁语相近的语言。这些高大俊美的人们崇拜着太阳。这座城市非常富有，人们都穿戴金饰，因此一定有黄金的来源。

original: Send out the conquistador! We must find this place.
translation: 派出征服者！我们一定要找到这个地方。

original: It's a futile endeavor.
Kingdom of Saguenay

There have been rumors about a kingdom in the north of the Americas ruled by white, blond men whose treasury is overflowing of gold, silver and rubies. An explorer, his fleet frozen in the mouth of a river, spent a winter in $PROVINCENAME$ and was told about the Kingdom of Saguenay by the natives. With signs and gestures towards his gold-and-silver insignia the natives relayed that precious metals came from the northwest, from a tribe most aggressive and warmongering. They are as white of skin as the explorer himself, and clad similar. The inhabitants of Saguenay are a numerous people, law abiding and wealthy.
translation: 有传言说，美洲北部有一个由金发碧眼的白人统治的王国，他们的国库里堆满了黄金、白银和红宝石。有一位探险家，他的舰队冻结在河口，在$PROVINCENAME$度过了一个冬天，当地人告诉了他关于萨格纳伊王国的传说。用标记和手势示意他的金银徽章后，原住民说出这种贵金属来自西北方一个更加好战激进的部落。他们和探险家一样皮肤白皙，穿着相似。萨格奈王国的居民众多，遵纪守法而又富有。

original: Go forth and find the Kingdom of Saguenay!
translation: 继续深入并找到萨格奈王国！

original: Bah, mere rumors are not good enough. We need proof!
translation: 哈？仅仅是传闻是不够的，我们需要证据！

original: Quivira

The lack of wealth in $PROVINCENAME$ disappointed the conquistador greatly, but the tales told by a native known as 'The Turk' cheered him up. A wealthy civilization named Quivira lies far to the east - or was it north? - of $PROVINCENAME$, where the chief drink from golden cups hanging from the trees.
translation: $PROVINCENAME$的贫穷使征服者十分失望，但被称为‘图库族‘的原住民告知的传说使他重新振作起来。一个名为基维拉的富裕的文明坐落于$PROVINCENAME$的东方——还是北方？那里的酋长用在树上的金杯饮用。

original: Find the golden cups of Quivira!
A fruitless endeavor, I'm sure.
translation: 我确信将会是鸡肋的努力.

original: The Death of a Conquistador

The expedition had sent forth a scout with the instructions of sending back crosses to the main party with the size of the cross equal to the wealth discovered. When this unfortunate event happened, a cross tall as a person had arrived and the main party picked up their pace. As they entered [Root.GetCapitalName], they found that the natives of $PROVINCENAME$ had killed the scout and were waiting for the rest of the party. Most fell to the savages, but a desperate few managed to escape. They tell us that the conquistador was one of the first to die, and that the scout was to blame. He had offered a gift of a gourd with a red feather, which turned out to be the native's symbol for war.
translation: 探险队派出的一个斥候通过将十字架送回本营并以其尺寸说明所发现财宝的数量。当这件不幸的事发生时，一个一人高的十字架被送达，随后大本营开始了行动。当他们踏入[Root.GetCapitalName]时，他们发现$PROVINCENAME$的原住民已经把斥候杀死并静候探险队其他人的到来。大部分人都倒在了野蛮人的脚下，但有些人殊死一搏得以逃亡。他们说征服者是第一个牺牲的，而且那个斥候应该为此负责。他送出一个有红羽毛的瓢子，这被证明是这些原住民中战争的标志。

original: We mourn the loss of a great conquistador.
translation: 我们会悼念这个征服者的离世.

original: Eat Leather or Starve to Death

The expedition was low on supplies even before we entered $PROVINCENAME$, but now we have to survive off what the land provides - which isn't much. Snakes taste like chicken and leather... Close your eyes hard as you chew on boiled leather from your scabbard or armor, and you might believe that it is beef jerky you are chewing on. Please send help, or we will never reach our destination.
translation: 探险队在进入$PROVINCENAME$前早已缺水少粮,但现在我们不得不依靠这片土地提供的食物为生-然而并不多.蛇类吃起来如同鸡肉和皮革... 在啃食已煮过的你们刀鞘或是胄甲上的皮革时请紧闭双眼,你或许会觉得你是在啃牛肉干.请派出救援,否则我们将饿死途中.

original: Help will be sent!
Find some natives and have them feed you.
translation: 找些原住民，让他们给你们吃的.

original: When Natives Attack

They were a terrifying sight, these half-clothed women with spears, clubs, bows and arrows in their hands and the sound that emerged from their throats as terrifying as the roar from a tiger! These warrior women from $PROVINCENAME$ were named Amazons by the survivors of our expedition and those they did not wound or kill were taken prisoner. Among them was the conquistador, the leader of this quest.
translation: 他们看起来令人惧怕,这些半裸的女人手握长矛,棍棒和弓箭,他们喉咙中发出的声音就像虎吼一般可怕!这些$PROVINCENAME$的女战士被探险队的幸存者称作亚马逊人,那些她们没有击伤或杀死的人被俘虏了.他们之中有征服者,这次探索的领队.

original: Find them and persuade them to release their captives!
translation: 找到她们并让她们释放俘虏!

original: They will release him and the rest when they tire of him.
translation: 她们厌倦之时便会放了他和其他人。

original: A Glimmer of Hope

We have fought off natives, ate strange fruit and stranger animals, caught diseases that no one should ever have to endure, and despaired for every step leading us away from inhabited cities. The only thing that has kept us moving forward was the stubbornness, the curiosity, and the firm belief of our leader that we will find the place we are looking for. Even their iron will seems to have faded these last days, and had it not been for a great discovery in $PROVINCENAME$, they would have ordered our retreat.
translation: 我们击退过原住民,吃过奇异的水果和更奇异的动物,患过没有人曾承受过的病痛,越是远离有人的城市我们就越感绝望.支撑我们前行的就只有固执,求知欲,以及领队对发现所觅之地的坚定信念.即使他们的钢铁意志也似乎在近日有所消退,而且因为在$PROVINCENAME$所得甚微,他们将会下令让我们撤退.

original: We found gold?!
Spirited Away

It could be the guards' fault, for they slept on their watch. Or was it the native, who we hired to lead us through the inhospitable $PROVINCENAME$, who is to blame? Maybe it was the conquistador who slept so soundly through it all that they did not even wake up to scream and yell as the natives silently made off with them into the deep forests. Either way: Our conquistador disappeared in the night and we need to go look for them.
translation: 这是警卫们的过错,因为他们在看守时睡觉了.或许是那个原住民,我们曾雇佣以带领我们穿越不好客的$PROVINCENAME$,谁该负责呢？或许是征服者们由头到尾都这样呼呼大睡因而在原住民们悄悄地把他们带入深林中时甚至没有惊动我们醒来大喊.无论如何:我们的征服者们神隐于夜因而我们需要去寻找他们.

original: Take some soldiers and go find the conquistador!
translation: 带上一些士兵并找到征服者!

original: They'll turn up, sooner or later.
translation: 他们会出现的,迟早的事.

original: Long Pig

The expedition stumbled upon a small, friendly tribe of natives in $PROVINCENAME$ who invited them to a feast to celebrate a recent victory over a neighboring tribe. There was plenty of meat, with a taste that reminded the conquistador of pork, and the name was apparently 'long pig'. It wasn't until after the feast the source of meat was explained: Captives from the defeated tribe sacrificed and eaten to gain the strengths of their enemies...
translation: 探险队在$PROVINCENAME$偶遇了一个友善的小型原住民部落,被邀请参加一个庆祝近期对邻近部落的胜利的庆典.庆典里有很多肉,肉的味道使征服者想起了猪肉,这种肉似乎产自一种叫'长猪'的动物身上.在庆典结束后肉的来源才得以解释:来自于那些被献祭的敌对部落的俘虏,进食这些肉能够从他们的敌人身上获得力量...

original: Any rumors of this must be silenced!
translation: 关于这事的谣言绝对不能外传!

original: Pray that the conquistador keeps their mouth shut.
translation: 祈祷这些征服者的嘴巴能严密点.

original: El Dorado - a myth

Years of struggle - or so it must have felt - have yielded next to nothing! The conquistador has given up the quest for El Dorado, claiming that the city of gold is nothing but myth and legend. A few provinces found, a few natives pleased with baubles and trinkets - but no gold, no diamonds, and certainly not a city with streets laden with gold.
translation: 多年的奋斗——感觉上或者是这样的——的成果微乎其微！征服者已经放弃了搜寻黄金国，宣称黄金打造的城市仅仅是一个故事，一个传说。虽然发现了一些城市，用廉价的首饰取悦了一些土著——然而并没有发现黄金，也没有发现钻石，当然也没有发现任何用黄金铺路的城市。

original: What a pity.
El Dorado - City Under Water

Lake Guatavita is rumored to be the lake where the Golden King washes off the gold dust he is covered with in a ritual that stretches over several days. Several trinkets made of gold and covered in precious stones have been found in the water, and our conquistador has started an ambitious project: Try and drain the lake by using a 'bucket chain' of laborers. Though they have worked tirelessly for three months, the water level has only been reduced by ten feet, and only a small amount of gold has been recovered.
translation: 瓜塔维塔湖据传就是黄金之王在持续数日的仪式中把身上的金粉洗掉的地方.在水下一些镶着宝石的金饰被发现了,我们的征服者启动了一项富有雄心的工程:试图通过使用劳工组成的'水桶链'抽干这个湖.尽管他们不知疲倦地工作了三个月,水平线仅仅下降了十英尺,也仅仅发现了少量的黄金.

original: It is better than nothing.
The Discovery of El Dorado!

Houses decorated with gold, statues covered in precious stones and a lake with its bed covered in gold dust, gems and other valuables... El Dorado has been found and its wealth is immense! Not only will this bring a great deal of wealth to our own country, but also prestige and the admiration of other countries.
translation: 数不清的用黄金铺饰的房屋，宝石铺饰的雕塑还有一个湖床铺满金粉，宝石和其他贵重品的湖泊……有着无尽财宝的黄金国被发现了！这不仅仅会为我国带来大量的财宝，而且会带来威望和其他国家的敬慕。

original: The conquistador will be rewarded!
Fountain of Youth - Death by Water

After many months of trekking through provinces filled with poisonous plants, venomous snakes, frogs and insects, dangerous animals of all kinds and sizes, the puddle in $PROVINCENAME$ known as the Fountain of Youth was finally found. Its water is muddy brown and it is cursed with a stench that could awaken even the dead. Only one brave soul volunteered to drink from the Water of Life and his body was buried the day after, ravaged by diarrhoea and violent heaves.
translation: 经历了数月在布满各种毒草毒蛇,毒蛙毒虫,猛禽野兽的土地上的长途跋涉后,在$PROVINCENAME$被称作青春之泉的水潭终于被发现了.它的潭水是泥棕色的,其恶臭如同被下了诅咒,连死者也会被臭醒.只有一个勇士自愿饮用这种生命之水,他的遗体第二天就被埋葬了,他死前深受腹泻折磨,眼睑外凸.

original: He chose... poorly
Fountain of Youth - Refreshing Water

A small waterfall feeds into the Fountain of Youth in $PROVINCENAME$, whose bright blue, crystal-clear water looks almost as good as it tastes. Our weary expedition members claim that bathing in the water refreshed them both physically and mentally, clearing most of the tiredness and all of the grime from their minds and bodies. But it did not last long, only hours after their baths the tiredness was back, and water brought in canteens from the lake only quenched their thirst.
translation: 一个小瀑布流入位于$PROVINCENAME$的青春之泉中,水色澄澈发蓝,如水晶般晶莹,就像它尝起来那么好.据疲倦的探险队员称在这水中洗澡使他们身心爽朗,疲倦基本得以消除,身心污垢均被洗净.但这种体验并不能长久,洗浴后数小时疲倦便卷土重来,用水壶带走的湖水仅有解渴的功效.

original: Good while it lasted, at least.
translation: 这种感觉持续时感觉很好,至少是这样的.

original: Fountain of Youth - True Water of Life

Wrinkles faded away, eyesights improved, gout disappeared and troubled minds finally found peace. Water sweeter than nectar, clearer than any cut diamond, and more well-guarded than the crown jewels of any country - but now it is ours: The Fountain of Youth! Be careful though, as imbibing in the precious water might cause some... unforeseen side effects. Too much of the good stuff and all that.
translation: 皱纹消褪,视力见长,关节疼痛消去,烦恼的心灵寻得平静.泉水比花蜜还甜美,比钻石还晶莹,被守护在比任何国家的冠上明珠更安全的地方-但现在已为我们所有:青春之泉!但是要谨慎,因为饮用这种珍贵的泉水或许会带来一些...不可预知的副作用.太多的好东西都是如此.

original: Perfect! Just ration the water and we are good to go.
translation: 简直完美!稍取数瓢就应离去.

original: Cibola - The Monk's Lies

The small city with ramshackle adobes and dirty streets, nothing like the houses made of gold and streets paved with precious stones described to us, met our conquistador and the expedition when they finally reached 'Cibola' in $PROVINCENAME$. The monk tried to stutter an explanation, about seeing the city in a different light - perhaps a sunset would paint it golden? But nothing he said could quell the rage and disappointment everyone felt.
translation: 小城中布满摇摇欲坠的矮墙和邋遢的街道，在我们的征服者和探险队到达位于$PROVINCENAME$的锡沃拉时，并没有向我们所述的类似金制房屋和宝石街道的东西迎接我们。那个僧侣结结巴巴地向我们解释，关于他之前在不同的光照中目睹这座城市——或许在黄昏中它会呈现金黄色？但无论他说什么都不能平息大家的愤怒和失望。

original: He lied? He lied to US?!
Cibola - Not Quite Golden

There was some gold, and a few precious stones, but it was fiercely guarded by the natives of $PROVINCENAME$. The monk who led us to 'Cibola' disappeared not long after the discovery, and most of the gold with him. Some trinkets and gold dust was recovered, not nearly enough to give Cibola the reputation as one of the Seven Cities of Gold.
translation: 城里有些黄金，还有些宝石，但处于$PROVINCENAME$的土著高度戒备中。带我们去'锡沃拉'的那个僧侣在这一发现后不久便不见踪影，带着大部分黄金一同消失了。虽然发现了一些金饰和金粉，但完全不足以让西伯拉拥有黄金七城之一的美誉。

original: There must be some truth to at least one of these myths!
translation: 这些传说中至少有一个是真的!

original: Golden Discovery - Cibola

Wealth comes in many different packages and ways - some claim that the wealth of heart is to be desired, others that piety and prestige should be the only wealth in life. Gold and precious stones is the only wealth our heart desires, and the Golden City of Cibola in $PROVINCENAME$ has made this desire grow fiercely. For every ounce of gold, for every handful of gems we want more and Cibola keeps on giving. One of the Seven Cities of Gold is ours, and we intend to keep it.
translation: 财富来自于各种各样的形态与方式——有人说应该追求的是心灵的财富，其他人说只有虔诚和威望是生命中的财富。我们的心灵渴求的只有黄金与宝石，位于$PROVINCENAME$的锡沃拉城使这渴求越发强烈。每得一盎司黄金，每得一捧宝石，我们就更贪得无厌，但锡沃拉一直予取予求。我们得到了黄金七城之一，我们也计划继续拥有它。

original: It is ours, our precious...
translation: 它是我们的，我们珍贵的……

original: City of the Caesars - False Gold

Everything that glimmers is not gold - something our conquistador learned the hard way. The expedition claimed to have found the City of the Caesars in $PROVINCENAME$, a golden city located between two mountains of gold and diamonds. Sadly, the 'gold' was mere pyrite and the 'diamonds' were quartz.
translation: 发光的不都是金子-我们的征服者深刻地领会到这一点.探险队宣称在$PROVINCENAME$发现了凯撒之城,一座坐落于黄金山与钻石山之间的黄金城.可悲的是,'黄金'仅是黄铜,'钻石'仅是石英.

original: I would have preferred something more... precious.
translation: 我喜欢一些更加...珍贵的东西。

original: City of the Caesars - True Silver

Mountains of gold and diamonds, and beneath it one of the Seven Cities of Gold... The mountains were only two small hills in $PROVINCENAME$. They held some precious metal and stones, but the metal was not the color of the sun but the color of the moon - a handful of silver and quartz was all the conquistador could find.
translation: 漫山的黄金钻石,其下是黄金七城之一... 所谓的大山仅仅是在$PROVINCENAME$的两个小山丘.山里有些宝石和贵金属矿,但那种金属的颜色并非日曜之金而是月光之银-征服者所能发现的只有一捧白银和石英.

original: It's better than nothing.
The City of the Caesars - Mountains of Wealth

Between the two large mountains of gold and diamonds in $PROVINCENAME$ lie the City of the Caesars, a prosperous city filled with everything you could wish. Food and drink aplenty, eaten and drunk from gold plates rimmed with precious stones. We have found it and claimed it, and we will be rich when all that wealth has been transported home.
translation: 凯撒之城坐落于$PROVINCENAME$的两座黄金钻石山之间，它是一座应有尽有的富饶之城。甘酿佳肴，饮食皆用镶钻金碟。我们发现了它并宣称了所有权，我们将会在这些财宝运回家时一夜暴富。

original: Just think about all that gold and prestige this will bring!
translation: 想想这会带来的黄金与威望！

original: Sierra de la Plata and the False King
translation: 拉普拉塔山与虚假君王

original: There was a White King in $PROVINCENAME$ but his Mountain of Silver was a hoax. Sierra de la Plata is yet another myth too many fools have fallen for, and we have to admit that we were another of them.
translation: 在$PROVINCENAME$确实有一个白银之王但他的银山只是一场骗局。拉普拉塔山是一个有太多傻瓜掉进去的谎言，我们也不得不承认我们就是又一批傻瓜。

original: It was too good to be true.
translation: 要是是真的就好过头了。

original: Sierra de la Plata - Close, but no Silver
translation: 拉普拉塔山——靠近了，没有白银

original: Not a mountain of silver, not one of the Seven Cities of Gold, but Sierra de la Plata was a true legend found by us - finally! It was located in $PROVINCENAME$ and an adequate amount of silver is being brought back each month to us.
translation: 虽然不是一座银山，也不是黄金七城之一，但最终拉普拉塔山是由我们发现的一个真正的奇迹！它坐落于$PROVINCENAME$，每月都会从那里运回可观的白银给我们。

original: Good!
Sierra de la Plata - Mountain of Silver

Beneath a large mountain filled with silver a White King resides. Sierra de la Plata - Mountains of Silver - has grown from a legend to a real city in $PROVINCENAME$ and we were the first civilized people to find it! Rejoice, for we have found a place of immense wealth and a people so gullible we will have no problem taking what we want, nay, what we need!
translation: 在一座白银之山下居住着一个白银之王。拉普拉塔山——白银之山——从一个传说成为了一个实际存在于$PROVINCENAME$的城市，而我们是首批发现它的文明人类！庆幸吧，因为我们发现了一个有着无穷财富的地方，这里的住民如此天真，我们将毫不费力地得到我们想要的东西，不，是我们需要的东西！

original: Great!
No Trace of Norumbega

The city of Norumbega must be a hoax made up by the French navigator who claimed to have discovered it. The only 40-leagues-wide river is devoid of islands and there is no sign of a town farther up. We have been gullible enough to believe something as preposterous as a Viking settlement and wasted time to try and find it.
translation: 诺伦贝加一定是那个宣称发现了它的法国航海家编造的谎言。这条仅仅有40里格宽的河一个岛屿也没有，在更远处也没有城镇的踪迹。我们太天真了，以至于相信像维京人的定居点这样荒谬的事情，并且浪费时间去寻找它。

original: Too bad...
Disappointing Norumbega

The town lay exactly where the French navigator had reported, at the mouth of a river 40 leagues wide. There was no sight of the tall, handsome and clever inhabitants he had spoken of, but the natives were very friendly and had lots of furs and sable to trade.
translation: 小镇的位置和那个法国航海家描述的完全一致，就在一条40里格宽的河口。但是这里并没有他所说的高个，漂亮且聪明的原住民，不过他们倒是对我们非常友好，这里也有许多毛皮和貂皮可供贸易。

original: I had expected more.
Norumbega Discovered

The people of Norumbega are tall, clever and handsome, with a language which shares a lot of words with Latin. We had hoped for a small town with some gold and furs, but Norumbega far exceeded all our expectations with its rich land, gold mine, and fur trade. It is an old Viking settlement, so much have we gathered from the people, and they are willing to trade with us. The gold mine seems to contain an endless stream of gold and as long as we provide our own work force, we are allowed to mine it.
translation: 诺伦贝加的居民身材修长，聪明英俊，并操一种从拉丁语大量借词的语言。我们原本只期望这里能有个小镇，出产一点黄金和毛皮，但诺伦贝加超出了我们的期待，这里有富饶的土地，高产的矿藏和毛皮贸易。这里是一个古老的维京人定居点，我们已经从他们身上得到了不少东西，他们也愿意跟我们进行贸易。这里的金矿品位如此之高，似乎能产出源源不断的黄金，只要我们能够提供自己的劳动力，我们就被允许进行开采。

original: This is great news!
Mere Myths - Saguenay

Charts painted with great care, landmarks discovered and natives guiding us, despite all this we have come no closer to finding the Kingdom of Saguenay. This is a hopeless quest, there is nothing of value in the north-west of the Americas. Let the conquistador come back home, or send the expedition out to search for something more tangible, something that is more than a myth or legend told by ignorant and savage natives.
translation: 我们有细致绘制的航海图、已知的地标，还有当地人的指引，即便如此，我们还是没有能够发现传说中的萨格奈王国。这真是无望的探险，北美洲的西北角没有什么值钱的东西。让探险家回国吧，或者让他们去一些更实际的地方搜寻，至少不应该是无知的不开化野蛮人随口胡诌的一些传说。

original: We have no other choice. End the search for Saguenay.
translation: 别无选择，停止搜寻萨格奈

original: Hoax by Indians - Saguenay
translation: 印第安人的恶作剧——萨格奈

original: As the expedition neared its destination - the legendary Kingdom of Saguenay, on par with any of the Seven Cities of Gold - El Dorado included - the anticipation grew with every step. Silver mines, ruby mines and gold mines - the mere thought of the treasures awaiting made most of the crew salivate. The first sight was a palisade encircling the town and smiles of greed was plastered on every face. These were soon exchanged for looks of disbeliefs and hearts turning to stone in their chests. The inhabitants were not white, were not clad in similar clothes to us and were certainly not wealthy. It was yet another tribe of natives, with more riches than most but this was no City of Gold.
translation: 这场探险快要到达它的目的地——传说中的萨格奈王国了，和搜寻黄金七城——包括黄金乡一样，探险中的每一步进展都带来更多的期待。银矿、宝石矿、金矿——仅仅是想一想近在眼前的财宝就让人口水直流。第一眼看到的是环绕小镇的栅栏，贪婪的笑容浮现在每个人的脸上。然而很快的这些人的表情就变成难以置信，心情跌落到谷底。定居者并不是白人，穿着跟我们不相似的服装，而且一眼便知他们肯定不富有。这只不过是另一个原住民部落，也许比其他的稍微富有一些，但肯定不是黄金之城。

original: They are willing to trade, that is something at least.
translation: 至少他们愿意跟我们做生意。

original: The Discovery of the Kingdom of Saguenay

The expedition was greeted with great hospitality by the white inhabitants of the Kingdom of Saguenay. They told a saga of having traveled on great boats some hundred years ago or so to Vinland as they call this continent. Gold, silver and ruby mines were soon found and tribes around became interested in their findings, leading the Saguenais to build up a reputation as fierce and brutal warriors. They reluctantly shared their wealth with us after we showed our superiority with guns and swords.
translation: 探险队受到了好客的萨格奈王国的白人居民热情的接待。他们讲述先人的传说，几百年前他们坐着大船航行到此地，他们把这片大陆称作文兰。黄金、白银和宝石矿很快被发现了，当地的部落也对他们的发现非常感兴趣。虽然萨格奈人有着勇猛战士的声誉，他们还是不情愿地和我们分享了他们的财富，因为我们给他们展示了我们强力的火器威力。

original: This is glorious!
Nothing but Abodes

'The Turk' filled the conquistador's ears with tales of the wealthy city of Quivira, of the fat land well watered by springs and rivers, the gold that adorned the houses and the fat, happy people. What the expedition found, however, was just more farming people living in a flat-roofed adobe town!
translation: ‘土耳其人’唾沫四溅地跟探险家说着关于富饶的基维拉城的故事，那里土地肥沃，被溪流河水环绕，黄金修饰的房屋，以及心宽体胖的人民。然而到了那儿才发现那里只有一些住在平顶土房子里的一些种地人。

original: The Turk should be strangled for his lies!
translation: 那个撒谎的土耳其人真该被掐死！

original: Fruitful City

Quivira is a well settled town, with the land itself being very flat and black. Rivulets, springs and rivers ensure that it is well watered. Prunes, nuts, sweet grapes, and mulberries were found in excess. There are abundant jade deposits in the caves, but no gold at all. The legendary city exists, and although wealthy, it is not how we were told to picture it.
translation: 基维拉是个不错的小镇，土地很平坦肥沃。环绕的溪流河水保证了充足的灌溉。梅子，坚果，葡萄和桑葚产量甚至过剩。这里的洞穴里藏着不少玉石，但没有任何黄金。传说中的城市确实存在，不过虽然很富足，但这跟我们听说的故事相去甚远。

original: At least we found it.
Legendary City of Quivira

Golden cups hang from the trees in the city of Quivira and anyone who is thirsty may take one and fill it with sweet water from one of the many springs, rivers, and rivulets that keep the area well watered. Prunes, nuts, mulberries, and sweet grapes bigger than anyone has ever seen must be the reason behind the large people of good build that inhabits the city. Gold and jade in great deposits in caves ensure the wealth of the city.
translation: 在基维拉城，黄金制作的杯子就挂在树上，任何人只要感觉到口渴，都可以拿着杯子到附近丰富的溪流里舀一杯水喝。这里的梅子，坚果，葡萄和桑葚比我们中任何人见过的个头都要大，也许这就是城里的居民块头那么大的原因。洞穴里藏着大量的黄金和玉石，这座城市真是富有极了。

original: We have found it! Finally!
The Search for El Dorado
Your conquistador is looking for El Dorado - the City of Gold.
translation: 你的探险家正在搜寻埃尔多拉多——黄金国。

original: El Dorado
We have discovered one of the ancient Seven Cities of Gold. Though it is long abandoned, overflowing riches lie within!
translation: 我们发现了古老的黄金七城中的一座。尽管它已经被遗弃了很久，但依然遍地是财宝！

original: The Search for Fountain of Youth
Your conquistador is looking for Fountain of Youth - the Water of Life.
translation: 你的探险家正在搜寻青春之泉——生命之水。

original: 'Water of Life'
The water of the Fountain of Youth is refreshing and sweet, and it serves as a place of pilgrimmage and wonder. There is little to be said for its ability to restore life, however...
translation: 青春之泉的水清新甜美，是朝圣和探险的地方。然而，它恢复生命的能力很难说...

original: The Search for Cibola
Your conquistador is looking for Cibola - one of the Seven Cities of Gold.
translation: 你的探险家开始搜寻锡沃拉——黄金七城之一。

original: Cibola
The legend of Cibola was true! A city covered with gold, gems and all manner of precious gewgaw.
translation: 锡沃拉的传说是真的！一座覆盖着黄金、宝石和各种华而不实的珍宝的城市。

original: The Search for the City of the Caesars
Your conquistador is looking for the City of the Caesars - a prosperous and rich city, full of gold, silver and diamonds.
translation: 你的探险家正在寻找凯撒之城——一个充满了黄金、白银和钻石的繁荣富饶的城市。

original: City of the Caesars
The legendary Ciry of the Caesars sits astride a veritable mountain of quartz. It would take us hundreds, if not thousands of years to mine it all!
translation: 传说中的凯撒之城坐落在一座名副其实的石英山上。若不是已经经历了几千年的时间，我们也得花上几百年才能把它挖出来！

original: The Search for Sierra de la Plata
Your conquistador is looking for Sierra de la Plata - the Silver Mountains.
translation: 你的探险家开始搜寻拉普拉塔山——白银之山。

original: Sierra de la Plata
The legend of Sierra de la Plata speaks of a mountain filled with silver. Not only was the legend correct, but it negelected to mention the crown of diamonds perched atop the ancient throne!
translation: 拉普拉塔山脉的传说讲述了一座满载白银的山脉。这个传说不仅是正确的，还否定了在古代王座上放置着钻石王冠的说法。

original: Sierra de la Plata
The Silver Mountain, ruled by a White King, was found by our conquistador! It will bring prestige and gold to our country.
translation: 白王统治的银山我们的探险家发现了！它将给我们的国家带来声望和财富。

original: The Search for Norumbega
The conquistador is looking for Norumbega - a Viking settlement in North America with great riches.
translation: 探险家正在搜寻诺伦贝加——北美一个非常富有的维京人定居点。

original: Quivira
A land where golden cups hang from the trees - this is the place the conquistador is looking for.
translation: 这里黄金的杯子直接挂在树上 - 我们的探险家正在找寻它在何方

original: Norumbega
The ancient city of Norumbega is discovered! A wealth of precious metals lie in open seams on its very streets.
translation: 古城诺伦贝加被发现了！大街上敞开的缝隙里塞满了大量的贵金属。

original: The Search for Kingdom of Saguenay
Your conquistador is looking for the Kingdom of Saguenay - a kingdom rumored to have mines of gold, silver and rubies in North America.
translation: 你的探险家正在找寻萨格奈王国 - 一个传言中位于北美拥有黄金，白银和玉石矿藏的国家。

original: Kingdom of Saguenay
The ancient city of Saguenay is filled with heretic idols and golden statues of cavorting pagan gods. It is our duty to melt them down and repurpose the riches.
translation: 古城萨格奈充满了异端的塑像和异教徒的黄金神像。我们有责任将它们融化并重新分配掉。

original: The Golden City of Quivira

Despite the lack of golden cups hanging from branches, valuable jade deposits have been located under the ruined city. It will take time and effort, but extracting this material will prove a most worthy endeavour.
translation: 尽管没有长在树枝上的金杯，珍贵的玉石矿藏还是在这座被毁的城市的地下被找到了。虽然需要花费大量时间和努力，提取这些材料将被证明是一项最有价值的成就。

original: Cannibal Conquistador
Threatened Punishment
The Woman Among Us
translation: 这个女人就在我们之间

original: While replenishing our supplies in $PROVINCENAME$, a young, pregnant woman and her husband, a well-known trapper, applied for the positions of interpreter and guide in our expedition. The woman speaks several languages while her husband is a good hunter with great knowledge of this continent.
translation: 当我们在$PROVINCENAME$进行补给时，一个年轻的孕妇和她的丈夫——一个有名的诱捕猎人，应聘我们探险中的口译和向导。那个女子会讲几种语言，而她的丈夫是个很好的猎人，在这片大陆上应该算是学识丰富了。

original: Hire them.
We don't need them.
Saved by a Princess

We cannot imagine the terror our conquistador must have felt when he laid his head onto a great stone while seeing men standing ready with clubs above his head. Luckily for him, the chief's dearest daughter rushed forth and placed her head upon his to save him from death.
translation: 我们无法想象当我们的探险家趴在一块大石头上等着被人砍头时的那种恐怖。幸运的是，领主的女儿冲上前去用自己的头护住了他。

original: We must make sure this does not happen again.
translation: 我们必须确保这不会再发生。

original: They are barbarians!
Attacked by Natives

Tragic news: our conquistador is dead! The expedition was traveling upriver by canoe when they encountered natives. The warlike tribe demanded that they come ashore and some of the men complied. They were disarmed and stripped naked, something our conquistador objected to. He refused the orders and died riddled with bullets. The expedition members saw his body brought ashore and hacked to pieces. Only one survived, who was told to leave and run. The natives pursued him and he ran for his life. Naked, exhausted and bleeding, the survivor had only one assailant pursuing him after several miles. He managed to overcome the lone man and found shelter in $PROVINCENAME$.
translation: 悲剧：我们的征服者死了！当他们正在用独木舟说溯流而上时遇到了土著。这个好战的部落要求他们靠岸，一些人听从了这个要求。他们随后被解除了武装并扒掉了衣服，而我们的征服者拒绝服从。他在用子弹表明自己拒绝的立场时最终战死。远征队的成员看到他的遗体在河边被分尸。只有一个成员活了下来，他被告知可以逃跑，随后土著开始追杀他。这个浑身赤裸，遍体鳞伤的成员在几英里的逃亡后发现只有一个人在追他了。他成功的战胜了那个人并最终在$PROVINCENAME$找到了庇护。

original: How terrible!
Lost in Mind and Space

We should have realized that our conquistador had no sense of orientation at all the first two times he got lost. The first time, he went to retrieve two of our pack horses and got lost for sixteen days. If it hadn't been for some grapes and rabbits, he would have starved. He later told us that he thought he was behind the expedition and sped up to catch up with it, then he got hungry so he went downstream to look for a trading party. The expedition sent their best hunter to find him and were finally reunited with him. The second time he explored one of three forks of a river and disappeared for three days. Once again the expedition sent the seasoned hunter to find him and he told a tale of trying to backtrack the forks and following our trails. This made the crew decide that the conquistador would not be left alone to discover more parts of $PROVINCENAME$, but that still did not help. Only mere minutes later he was gone again.
translation: 我们早在我们的征服者前两次迷路的时候就应该意识到他是个路盲。第一次，他试图去牵马的时候迷路了十六天。如果不是葡萄和野兔，他已经饿死了。后来他告诉我们当时他以为他落在了远征队后面就试图加速赶上，随后他感到饿了于是就顺着河流而下试图找一个商队。远征队派遣最好的猎人去寻找他并最终找到了他。第二次，他试图去探索河流的三条支流中的一条并消失了三天。远征队又一次派遣最好的猎人去找他，这次他带来了一个试图沿着支流寻找我们足迹的故事。这些事让远征队的成员相信他们不能让征服者一个人去探索$PROVINCENAME$其他的区域，但是这并没有起到作用。几分钟后他又消失了。

original: Send the hunter out again.
Leave him. He'll have to find us this time.
translation: 随他去吧，这次让他自己找到回来的路吧。

original: A Dog's Life

A big, black dog by the name of Seaman had accompanied the expedition from the start, and had experienced many adventures. A beaver had bit him so badly that the expedition's doctor had to perform surgery on his hind leg. Mosquitoes plagued the expedition and the dog had howled with the torture experienced by them. Natives in $PROVINCENAME$ had stolen Seaman but he was retrieved shortly. Our conquistador has grown fond of the dog and would be devastated if anything happened to him.
translation: 一条被叫做希曼的大黑狗从一开始就远征队中，经历了许多冒险。一只河狸曾把它严重的咬伤，远征队的医生不得不为它的后腿进行手术。蚊虫曾经困扰着远征而这只狗的叫声在这场煎熬中始终伴随着他们。$PROVINCENAME$的土著曾经偷走了希曼但是不久后他就被救回。我们的征服者和这只狗建立了深厚的情感，如果这狗发生了任何事，他一定会完全陷入悲痛。

original: The tribes in $PROVINCENAME$ will know our wrath if anything happens to that dog!
translation: 如果这狗发生了什么，$PROVINCENAME$的部落会见识到我们的愤怒！

original: It's only a dog.
Faster, slowpokes!

The natives of $PROVINCENAME$ have not been exactly friendly to our expedition. The ones we met tried to steal our weapons during the night and during the struggle two natives were killed. Our crew managed to flee over 100 miles in a day before they dared camp again. There are signs that the natives are after them once more, and they might find the strength to repeat the marathon march if encouraged...
translation: $PROVINCENAME$的原住民严格来说对我们的远征并不友好。我们遭遇到的原住民试图在晚上偷窃我们的武器。在战斗中两名土著被杀了。 我们的队员在一晚上逃开了100英里才敢再次扎营。现在有迹象表明土著又追到他们身后了，如果发生遭遇，也许他们会有再跑一次马拉松的力气...

original: Flee, you fools!
Waving the White Flag

Two tribes, one from $COUNTRY$ and one from a neighboring country are rivals, something our conquistador didn't realize until too late. They both demanded tribute from the expedition to allow them passage. By offering one native chief gifts first, our conquistador insulted and angered the other chief. The gifts offered were not to the chiefs' satisfactory and some warriors tried to take the expedition's provisions. The conquistador took a firm stand and presented arms, his second in command brandished his sword and threatened violence. The chiefs backed down and better gifts were presented to them both.
translation: 来自$COUNTRY$和另一个相邻国家的部落是宿敌。我们的征服者在意识到这一点时已经太晚了。这两个部落都向远征队讨要礼物以换取允许远征队通过。征服者在先给其中一个酋长礼物的举动显然激怒了另一个酋长。我们的礼物也并没有使酋长满意，一些土著战士试图来夺取远征的补给。征服者并没有屈服而是亮出了武器，他的副官挥舞着佩剑并威胁以武力。酋长退却了，两份更好的礼物被同时送到了两边。

original: Try to make them bury the hatchet.
Good work!
Bleeding Gums and Falling Teeth

With a diet consisting mostly of cured and salted meat and dried grains, the malaise and lethargy should have been the first symptoms recognized as scurvy, but it was not until gums started bleeding and teeth falling out that we realized we had to do something to save our expedition members. As they are exploring provinces that have an unknown flora and fauna to us, it would be unwise to eat anything as it could be poisonous. Maybe we should try to establish contact with the natives of $PROVINCENAME$ and ask for their help?
translation: 在几乎全由腌肉和干粮组成的食谱的情况下，萎靡和嗜睡应该被认定为坏血病的首发症状，不过直到牙龈开始出血，牙齿开始脱落，我们才意识到必须做点什么来拯救远征队员。由于他们正在探索的区域有着我们完全未知的动植物，吃这些可能有毒的东西显然不太明智。也许我们应该和$PROVINCENAME$的土著取得联系已寻求他们的帮助？

original: Trade for the medicine!
No, try eating some fruit first.
The Amazons

In $PROVINCENAME$ there are two small tribes with a very special arrangement: The women live by themselves, far from the men who they only allow to visit them a couple of times each year. Any boy child fathered this way is returned to the father and the girls are kept by the women. If approached at any other time than is appointed, the women will defend themselves with bows and arrows. The men of the strange tribe are currently preparing for the next visit, and have invited the male expedition members to join them.
translation: 在$PROVINCENAME$有两个小部落非常奇特：女人独自生活，男人一年中只有几次能访问她们。 诞生的任何男孩都会被还给父亲而女孩会被留下。如果在任何其他时间去访问，这些女人会用弓箭保卫自己。这个奇怪部落的男人们正在准备下一次访问，并且邀请了男性探险队员加入他们。

original: That sounds like a bad idea.
translation: 这听起来像一个坏主意。

original: This might be the only way to learn more about these strange customs.
translation: 这也许是深入了解这一奇特风俗的唯一方法。

original: Mutiny in $PROVINCENAME$!

Several crew members of the conquistador's expedition were captivated by the idyllic life in $PROVINCENAME$ and decided to abandon the expedition. This was declared an act of mutiny by the conquistador and after a long hunt, the mutineers were captured. Should they be sent back to us and tried here, or should they be forgiven and allowed to return to the expedition as crew members after a bit of flogging?
translation: 一些征服者远征队的成员被$PROVINCENAME$的田园生活吸引，决定放弃远征。这被征服者认为是一种哗变的行为。在长时间的搜捕之后，哗变者被抓住了。他们应该被送回来接受审判，还是应该原谅他们并允许在一些鞭笞之后回到远征队中？

original: Send them back.
Flog them.
Wintering among the Natives

In the province of $PROVINCENAME$, our conquistador encountered natives who proved so friendly and welcoming that he lost sight of the time spent among them. His expedition was forced to spend the winter with their native friends and allies, but built up relations in doing so.
translation: 在$PROVINCENAME$，我们的征服者遇到了一些非常友好的原住民。他和他们在一起非常愉快甚至忘记了时间。远征不得不和这些友好的土著一起过冬，但这会建立起非常好的关系。

original: He wasted time but gained friends... good.
translation: 他浪费了时间但是获得了友谊……很好。

original: The Survivor

The expedition started with 600 men, but only four made it home alive. When they first arrived, the crew heard about another expedition where 450 of 600 men had perished. Fearing that they would face the same fate, many deserted. A hurricane struck the expedition not long after, and several men perished. Disaster after disaster struck the expedition, famine, disease and attacks from the natives. One of the four who returned home was Estevanico, a black slave born in Africa, who was taught by the conquistador the necessary skills to lead an expedition. He is available for hire, although we would suffer a small prestige hit if we appoint him our new conquistador.
translation: 远征开始时有600人，但只有4个人活着回来了。当他们刚开始旅途时，他们听说另一个600人的远征队损失了450人。许多人害怕遭受同样的命运所以逃走了。随后不久一场飓风袭击了队伍并带走了一些队员的生命。一场又一场灾难连续袭击着远征队：饥荒，疾病以及土著的攻击。四个幸存者之一是一位来自非洲名叫埃斯廷范尼克的黑奴。他受到征服者的教导学会了如何带领一次远征。我们可以雇佣他，然而如果雇佣他作为征服者我们的声望可能会受到一些影响。

original: Hire Estevanico, we need a new conquistador.
translation: 雇佣埃斯廷范尼克，我们需要一个新的征服者。

original: No, we will find a more suitable person for that.
translation: 不，我们会找到一个更合适的人。

original: Drunken Whiskey Thieves

Found singing loud, lecherous songs and swigging whiskey straight from the bottle, the two men were clearly guilty of their crime. To steal whiskey and drink it while on duty - how unprofessional! They were tried in martial court and sentenced to flogging, then released.
translation: 这两个人在被发现的时候，正在大声唱着粗俗的歌曲，直接对着瓶子喝着威士忌，他们显然是有罪的。在执勤的时候偷威士忌喝，这是何等的不专业。他们在军事法庭受到了审判，并被判处鞭刑后释放。

original: They did not deserve a flogging!
That taught them a lesson!
Hopefully this did not avert them too long from their goal...
translation: 希望这不会把他们从他们的目标上带走太远...

original: Peralta Gold Mine

The bloody massacre in $PROVINCENAME$ left few Peralta family members alive when natives attacked their routine gold expedition. The ones who survived have begged for the help of our conquistador and the soldiers of our expedition, promising much gold if their family is avenged.
translation: 佩拉尔塔家族在常规的采金之旅时遇到了原住民的攻击，在这场发生在$PROVINCENAME$血腥的屠杀过后，只有很少佩拉尔塔家族成员活了下来。幸存者前来寻求我们的征服者和远征队中的士兵的帮助，许诺了许多黄金来为他们家族复仇。

original: Whatever they need - as long as we get that gold!
translation: 只要我们能获得黄金，提供他们所需的一切。

original: The expedition has more pressing matters to attend to.
translation: 远征队有更重要的事情要做。

original: Gold and Diamonds

The remaining members of the Peralta family led us to the place of the massacre. The bodies were left untouched, the wagons destroyed... Our expedition helped bury the bodies while several scouts searched the area for any signs of the attackers. A few clues led toward the Peralta gold mine and as they approached it became clear that the attackers had taken shelter in the mines. One of the Peraltas confirmed that it was the same group that had attacked them. After a violent battle, the enemy lay dead on the ground outside the mine. The Peralta family kept their word and rewarded us with a large amount of gold.
translation: 佩拉尔塔家族剩余的成员把我们带到了屠杀发生的地方。尸体依然留在那里，马车被摧毁了... 我们的队伍帮助他们安葬了尸体并派出了一些斥候在周围区域搜索攻击者的线索。一些线索把我们指向了佩拉尔塔金矿。当我们接近的时候，我们清楚地发现攻击者躲在金矿里。一个佩拉尔塔家的人确认了这就是攻击他们的人。在一场激烈的战斗后，敌人倒在金矿外的土地上。佩拉尔塔家族信守了他们的承诺并用大量黄金回报了我们。

original: Honest pay for honest work.
Quartz and Pyrite

The bodies of the fallen Peralta family members had been savaged, which made it difficult to identify them. Burying them took precious time, and the scout sent out to search the surrounding areas for the attackers returned with nothing. The oldest son of the Peraltas, one of the few survivors, refused to give up. He led the expedition towards the Peralta gold mine, in case the attackers had found their way there. As they approached the mine, their fears were confirmed. The mine is no more, the attackers buried it in rubble and the gold is lost. The Peralta family was avenged, as the large group of attackers were taken by surprise and easily killed.
translation: 佩拉尔塔家族成员的遗体受到了严重的破坏，甚至难以辨认身份。埋葬他们占用了宝贵的时间，而派出去寻找攻击者线索的斥候什么都没有找到。幸存者之一，佩拉尔塔家的长子拒绝放弃，由于担心攻击者找到金矿，他带着远征队前往佩拉尔塔金矿。当他们接近金矿时，他们的恐惧得到了证实。金矿已经被摧毁了，攻击者把金矿夷为平地并带走了那里的黄金。佩拉尔塔家族的成员依然成功的复仇了，因为许多在攻击者在那里遭到了突然袭击而轻易的被杀了。

original: That's... something, at least.
translation: 至少... 还有些东西留下。

original: He's a Woman!

We would never had discovered that Baret was a woman had the natives not shouted it at the top of their lungs when the expedition entered $PROVINCENAME$. She had joined us as an assistant to our naturalist and as his ulcerated leg had brought him much discomfort, she had carried supplies and specimens in his stead. Baret claims to be our naturalist's housekeeper, but their relationship seems deeper than that. Should we allow her to remain with us on the expedition?
translation: 我们永远不会发现贝蕾是个女人，如果不是在我们进入$PROVINCENAME$时发现这个的土著用他们最大的声音喊了出来。她是作为我们的博物学家的助手加入的，当博物学家的腿部溃疡让他非常难受时，她则会替他携带补给和标本。贝蕾自称是我们的博物学家的管家，不过他们的关系似乎比此更深。我们是否应该允许她继续留在远征队中呢？

original: Yes, allow her to stay.
No, send her back!
Poison Rock

Nine horses died from eating poisonous plants, and the expedition was forced to leave behind two more who were near death. A cursed place with only poisonous plants and venomous animals and the conquistador regrets that they ever decided to camp there. A large rock formation provided shelter from the harsh winds that blew right through them, but Poison Rock, as it was named by the conquistador, is not a place for any man nor animal.
translation: 九匹马在吃了毒草后死了，另外有两匹濒临死亡的马也不得不被远征队抛弃。这是一个被诅咒的地方，这里只有毒草和带毒的动物。征服者很后悔他们决定在这里扎营。一些大石头挡住了猛烈的大风，然而毒石，征服者将这里命名为这个，并不是一个人类或动物能生存的地方。

original: Continue on foot if you have to!
translation: 如果不得不步行，就步行继续！

original: False as diamonds of $PROVINCENAME$

Our explorer has sent us gems he claims to have found in $PROVINCENAME$. White and glittering, he believes them to be diamond, but our learned scholars tell us that they are common quartz instead. Far from a source of wealth, they have become a source of ridicule...
translation: 我们的探险家送来了一些据称在$PROVINCENAME$发现的宝石。洁白而闪闪发光，他相信这些是钻石。但是我们的学者告诉我们这些只是普通的石英。他们并没有成为财富的来源，而是成为俄笑料的来源...

original: All is not diamonds that glimmer.
translation: 这些光芒都不是来自钻石。

original: A Deserter Resurfaces!

Words from our conquistador warned us that one of his trusted lieutenants had defected in despair at the state of the expedition. Our conquistador thought we had seen the last of this deserter, but our agents inform us that he has resurfaced and is peddling his charts to the merchants and explorers of our rival...
translation: 我们的征服者传来消息，一个他信任的副官由于对远征的状况感到绝望而背叛了。征服者认为这个逃兵已经死了，但是我们的密探告诉我们这个副官再次出现了并在向商人和我们对手的探险家兜售地图...

original: Stop him, discreetly.
Kill him and make an example out of him!
An account of the New Lands

Our conquistador may not have sent back gold, but he has sent back a magnificently detailed map of our new domains, and of all the unclaimed land waiting only for brave settlers to claim their destiny...
translation: 我们的征服者可能并没有带回黄金，但是他带回了我们新的殖民地和所有等待着勇敢的开拓者们的无主之地的非常详细的地图。

original: That's surprisingly good news, despite the lack of gold.
translation: 这是一个令人惊讶的好消息，尽管没有黄金。

original: Abandoned Mounds

From a distance, our conquistadors thought them to be mere hills standing among the otherwise empty plain in $PROVINCENAME$. But as we drew nearer, an enterprising fellow in the company noticed how regular they were, and he soon pointed out to his companions that they must be the remnants of the great pyramids of an ancient people.
translation: 从远处看，我们的征服者们觉得这些只是一些耸立在$PROVINCENAME$空旷平原上的小山。但是当抵近时，一个积极的成员注意到他们非常规则，不久后他向他的伙伴们提出这一定是古代人留下的大金字塔。

original: There must be gold underneath those hills! Dig them out, now!
translation: 这些山的下面一定有黄金！把他们挖出来！现在！

original: Leave them be, there's nothing but earth underneath them.
translation: 就这样吧，他们下面除了泥土什么都不会有。

original: Nothing but dirt
They were nothing but mere hills, that 'enterprising fellow' who thought them to be remnants of the great pyramids of an ancient people was wrong. Dirt was all the expedition found.
translation: 他们除了山什么都不是，那个认为这些是古代人的金字塔的“积极的成员”是错的。远征队只发现了泥土。

original: How disappointing!
Meager amount of Gold

The hills were the remnants of the great pyramids of an ancient people and the expedition found some gold in all that dirt. Although the expedition crew believed this to be a waste of time, and we do agree.
translation: 这些山丘的确是古代人留下的金字塔，远征队在泥土里发现了一些黄金。然而远征队员们觉得这是浪费时间，我们也同意这点。

original: We got some gold, that's good.
translation: 我们至少获得了些黄金，这很好！

original: Hic Sunt Dracones

The paint on the great rock that dominates the river is almost faded, but the six-legged, monster it displays is still visible. Our natives tell us a fanciful tale of a dragon-like monster slain by their ancestors, but some of them confusedly insist the painting to be a warning that we should not head further. What is certain is that all of our native guides insist on discharging their weapons at the painted figure as we pass by it.
translation: 在河流里耸立着的巨石上的岩画几乎消失了，但是这个六足的怪物依然可以辨认出来。我们的原住民告诉我们一个他们祖先屠龙的神奇的故事，但是他们其中的一些则认为这副画是一个告诫我们不应该继续前进的警告。唯一得到确认的是我们的土著向导都坚持在岩画前放下他们的武器。

original: Let us conserve our ammunition.
Let us support their war on the beast.
translation: 让我们协助他们对抗这个怪兽。

original: A Most Deadly lake

The natives whisper and throw evil glances toward the still water. They say that there is a spirit there, in the form of a great serpent or monster. They claim that this spirit ambushes canoes on the surface, pulling them to a watery grave. It may not be the work of monsters, but perhaps it would be wise to go the long way around?
translation: 原住民在窃窃私语并向安静的水面投以恐惧的目光。他们说那里有一个精灵，以一条巨蛇或怪物的形式出现。他们声称这个精灵会袭击水面上的独木舟并把他们拖入水中的墓地。也许这并不是怪物的作为，不过也许走一条远路绕过去更为明智？

original: Go around it.
There are no such thing as monsters, take the fast way across.
translation: 世界上没有怪物，走最快的路。

original: Disgusting!
Traditions Respected
The conquistador from $FROMCOUNTRY$ was very respectful and took care to engage in our traditions in a correct manner.
translation: 来自$FROMCOUNTRY$的征服者非常有礼貌并且他们小心翼翼的用正确的方式融入我们的传统。

original: That is important.
Insulted by Conquistador
We are enraged by the behavior of the conquistador from $FROMCOUNTRY$! They managed to insult not only us and our traditions, but also our beliefs!
translation: 来自$FROMCOUNTRY$的征服者的行为激怒了我们! 他们不仅仅侮辱了我们与我们的传统与，更侮辱了我们的信仰。

original: They will be punished!
Threatened by Conquistador
Something caused the conquistador from $FROMCOUNTRY$ to erupt into accusations and threats of bodily harm! This is greatly disturbing.
translation: 一些意外使得来自 $FROMCOUNTRY$ 征服者被指责威胁到了我们的身体健康! 这非常令人不安.

original: Whatever had we done to deserve this?
translation: 我们做了什么要受到这样的报应？

original: Friendly Conquistador
$FROMCOUNTRY$ should have praise for their friendly conquistador, their visit to our province has only been profitable.
translation: $FROMCOUNTRY$ 应该高度赞扬这些友好的征服者，他们的到访对我们省只有好处.

original: We will have to compliment them on that.
Peace brought by Conquistador
The enmity between us and a neighboring country caused a visiting conquistador from $FROMCOUNTRY$ to try and broker peace between us, which worked!
translation: 来自$FROMCOUNTRY$的征服者成功的化解了我们和领国之间的敌意并促成了和平。

original: We are astonished!
Interfering Conquistador
A conquistador from $FROMCOUNTRY$ tried to force us and our rival to bury the hatchet! The enmity between us and the neighboring country has never been stronger, all thanks to that meddling person.
translation: 来自$FROMCOUNTRY$的征服者试图强迫我们和和敌人和解! 由于他们的干预，我们和领国之间的敌意一直不是很强烈。

original: That's... surprising.
Conquistador will die.
Sacagawea
The Lemhi Shoshone woman Sacagawea was an interpreter and guide who accompanied the Lewis and Clark expedition.
translation: 莎卡嘉薇亚是一个肖松尼的女性翻译者和向导，帮助刘易斯和克拉克完成了探险活动。

original: Lost in the Woods
This is an easy province to get lost in.
Lost in the Woods
This is an easy province to get lost in.
Shortcut
Using fear as a great motivator, your troops and conquistador will fly through this province.
translation: 在恐惧的驱使下，你的部队和征服者将会飞速通过这个省份。

original: Shortcut
Using fear as a great motivator, your troops and conquistador will fly through this province.
translation: 在恐惧的驱使下，你的部队和征服者将会飞速通过这个省份。

original: Respected Tribe
Insulted Tribe
Interfering Intruder
Reluctant Peace
Jeanne Baret

Jeanne Baret was the naturalist Philibert Commerçon's housekeeper until he was invited to join Louis-Antoine de Bougainville's expedition. She disguised herself as a man and accompanied Commerçon as his assistant on the expedition.
translation: 珍妮 巴雷特是菲利普 科蒙斯的妻子，在菲利普应邀加入路易斯·安东尼·布干维尔的探险队之后. 她女扮男装，在探险过程中充当科蒙斯的助手.

original: Chart Peddler Stopped
A deserter from our expedition was... persuaded to stop selling charts and maps to merchants and conquistadors.
translation: 我们的探险队的一个逃兵……被说服停止销售图表和地图给商人和征服者。.

original: Deserter Killed
Our spies dealt with the deserter from our expedition, making an example of his death. No one deserts and then tries to peddle charts to our rival merchants and conquistadors!
translation: 我们的间谍处决了来自我们的探险的逃兵，让他成为了一个典型。自那以后再也没有逃兵并识图试图兜售图纸给我们的对手的商人和征服者！

original: New Domains
A magnificent detailed map of our new domains has inspired our people. They are clamoring to get there and claim the new land.
translation: 关于我们新的疆土的一份宏伟详细的地图激励了我们的人民。他们吵着要去那里宣称新的土地。

original: Abandoned Mounds
Underneath the earth covering surprisingly regular hills there might be the remnants of great pyramids, filled with gold and precious stones. It is worth investigating.
translation: 地表之下覆盖的普通土丘可能是金字塔的残留物，里面都是黄金和石块. 这值得调查.

original: The Monster in the Lake
A local superstition of a monster attacking canoes trying to cross the lake has slowed the expedition down.
translation: 一个疑似当地的怪物袭击了识图过湖的独木舟，这延缓了探索进程。

original: Nahuatl Reforms
Open up Sumptuary Restrictions

Our society has traditionally restricted the use of finer clothing, jewelry or even the amount of stories a house may have to the hereditary nobility. By opening up these perks to anyone who performs well on the field of battle we can create a state where every member of our society is ready to do their part in times of war.
translation: 我们社会的传统限制穿精细的服装，珠宝或是住能够表现显赫家世的多层住宅。通过开将这些开放给那些战场上表现好的人，我们可以建立一个社会成员在战争时勇于参战的国家。

original: Extend Pochteca Obligations

The Pochteca trade guilds have often come to act as our emissaries, diplomats and spies in relations with other city states. Let us formalize this relationship into a set of strict obligations to more efficiently handle our foreign relations.
translation: 在与其他城邦国家的交往中，波其德卡的贸易行会经常充当我们的特使，外交官和间谍。让我们为其制定更严格的规则，从而更有效地处理对外关系。

original: Warrior Ranks
By creating a system of ranks dependent on how many captives a warrior has taken during his career we can encourage each warrior in our armies to strive towards constantly improving his skills.
translation: 通过根据士兵在其职业生涯中捕获的俘虏数量制定一套评级系统，我们可以鼓励军队中士兵不断提高他们的技能。

original: Tribal Expansion
The lands to our north are dominated by many disorganized and isolated tribes. By sending groups of settlers and soldiers into these areas we can expand our state even into these desolate areas.
translation: 我们北方的土地被很多无组织与孤立的部落支配着.通过派遣定居者与士兵到哪里去， 我们可以将我们的国家扩展到那些偏远的地区.

original: Legal Reform

Until now the city states under our control have all had their respective legal systems controlled by their own respective judges. Let us create a set of central laws that need to apply throughout our empire and start educating judges centrally.
translation: 目前为止我们控制的下城邦国家的法律体系都由他们各自的法国控制. 让我们制定一部适用于整个帝国的中央法律并集中培训法官。

original: Inti Reforms
Organized Recruitment

While our subject peoples have always supplied troops for our armies they have done so to varying degrees and in an ad-hoc manner. By formalizing the need for every subjugated area to supply soldiers to the central state we will be able to tap the manpower resources of our lands in a much more efficient manner.
translation: 尽管我们的附庸一直为我们的军队提供部队，但他们各自的标准和做法都不同。通过为我们的附庸地区向中央国家提供士兵的要求制定统一标准，我们可以更加有效的利用我们的土地的人力资源。

original: Expanded Mitma Policy

The policy of moving entire villages from loyal areas into newly conquered land or into the frontier has helped expand the empire. This type of forced resettlement could also be used to resettle the population of newly conquered areas into the core parts of the empire. Strict laws should be put in place to forbid people from returning to their original homes.
translation: 将全体村民从当地移居到新征服的土地或者前线的政策成功的扩大了帝国. 这种强制移民的政策同样可以用来强迫新征服地区的人民移居到帝国的核心区域。 必须通过的严格的法律防止人们跑回他们原来的地区.

original: Reform the Cult of Inti

While Inti, the sun, is the foremost of all gods most of the peoples of the Andes also worship a variety of minor Huacas. We must require all corners of our empire to acknowledge Inti as their main god and that all Huaca idols are given to be kept by our ruler as Inti's foremost representative.
translation: 尽管太阳神英迪在所有神中的地位最高。 安第斯山脉的许多人民的也崇拜各种小瓦卡斯。我们必须要求我们的帝国的各个角落承认英迪作为他们的主神并且我们君主所保留的所有瓦卡斯都必须作为为英迪的代表。

original: Yana Lords

By moving away from the hereditary or local powerholders as the commanders of our armies we can instead promote a new class of leaders appointed directly by the state. Selected for their personal merit and loyalty this will ensure that our armies are always led by the fiercest supporters of our state.
translation: 通过将世袭的或当地的当权者调离我们的军队不再让他们担任指挥官，我们可以促使一个新的由政府直接任命的领导阶层的诞生。挑选忠于我们并认同我们思想的人员将确保我们的军队始终是我国领袖的最强的支持者。

original: Reform the Bureaucracy

In order to facilitate the rapid expansion of our empire it is necessary to create a new class of administrators to oversee everything from the construction of bridges, roads and tambos in newly acquired areas to the constant inspection of the regions already under our control.
translation: 为了方便我们帝国的迅速扩张，需要创建一个新的管理阶层来监督一切工作，从桥梁施工，新征服的地区的道路和路边酒馆的建设到到对我们控制下地区的不管检查。

original: Maya Reforms
A Unified Army

Our empire is made up of a number of Cahs, Altepetls and other minor city states that all acknowledge our central rule. While we can command the forces of all of these cities they are at the same time acting independently of each other and are paid for by their respective home cities. A unified army structure would ensure that less resources are wasted.
translation: 我们的帝国是由大量的城邦组成的，他们都承认我们的宗主地位。虽然我们可以掌握所有这些城市武装力量，但他们同时有一定的独立性并且由各自的城市支付薪水。一个统一的陆军的结构将确保减少资源的浪费。

original: Central Arbitration

While they are unified under our rule, the city states of our empire frequently get into conflict with each other over everything from trade rights to border demarcation. By creating a central arbitration authority we can greatly reduce these tensions.
translation: 虽然他们统一在我们的规则下，我们帝国的城邦之间经常发生冲突，从贸易纠纷到边界纠纷。通过创建一个中央仲裁机构可以大大缓和这些紧张局势。

original: Central Armories

In times of war it has been customary for the city states of Mesoamerica to arm the commoners in order to raise armies big enough to challenge their neighbors. As each state has its own armories the type and quality of arms can vary a lot within the empire. By creating a central system of armories from which all armies are equipped we can drastically increase the quality of our armed forces.
translation: 对于中美洲的城邦而言在战争时期武装普通人以聚集大量的军队对抗领国是一种习惯性做法，每个国家有它自己的类型和标准的军械库，与帝国军械愀完全不同。通过创建一个从中央军械库，一个装备齐全的军械库可以极大增强我们的武装部队的战斗力。

original: Tribal Expansion
Disorganized tribes control the jungles and highlands on the outskirts of Mesoamerica. Let us build new settlements in these areas and absorb these peoples into our empire.
translation: 混乱的部落控制着中美洲的丛林和高地郊区。让我们在这些地区建立新的定居点并吸收这些人加入入我们的帝国。

original: Reform the Bureaucracy
In order for our empire to grow at an acceptable speed we must create a new class of specialized administrators with the authority to quickly make executive decisions in newly conquered areas.
translation: 为了我们的帝国的扩张在可接受的范围内，我们必须创建一个的专业管理阶层，这一阶层有权在新征服地区快速做出处理决定。

original: Reform Passed

Reforming our society has its price. While the core areas of our state remain loyal to our rule many of the other Altepetls have found the changes too much to stomach and have used this opportunity to break their ties to us.
translation: 社会改革总是有代价的. 尽管我们的核心区域任然忠于我们的法律，许多其他Altepetls 却发生了许多改变并试图利用这个机会打破与我们之间的关系。

original: They will regret this.
Reform Passed

The successful implementation of our recent reforms has resulted in some distress, both among the nobles and among the Huaca-worshippers in the countryside, who feel left behind. They feel we are abandoning the ancient customs of both ours, and their forefathers and fear that this development will decrease their power and influence.\nThese dissenters have now joined forces with one of the influential Panaca lineages to put a candidate of their own on the throne.
translation: 我们最近的改革顺利实施在感到被忽视的贵族和农村瓦卡斯崇拜者中造成了一些困扰。他们觉得我们放弃我们的古老的习俗与他们的祖先，担心这种发展会降低他们的权力和影响力。\n这些持不同政见者现在已经与一个极具影响力的帕纳卡血统武装力量联合起来企图把自己的候选人送上王座。

original: They will regret this.
Reform Passed
